main event: A red disc-like object was observed through binoculars at Richards Gebauer AFB in Missouri, moving northeast for about 2 minutes before disappearing to the south.
interesting points: The object was observed both with the naked eye and through a 6-inch Newtonian telescope.
The object's angular rate of change increased from 2 degrees per minute to 15 degrees per minute as it passed near Sirius.
The object was surrounded by a faint bluish halo and had a reddish glow.
The observers initially thought the object was a pale star-like point of light, but upon further observation, they concluded it was a definite object.
The observers wondered if they had observed a vehicle of the Discoverer class on reentry just prior to becoming a fireball.
